page.title: ActionGrid - Context Menu with Data
page.content:
The purpose of this guide is to show how we can see from the context menu to an ActionGrid the data we want, in another page.

To begin with we will SELECT within the generator, in this case we are using the Northwind Customers table



Once the query is made we click on "Generate Grid", to generate a grid. After the XML configuration has been created, we will go to the "XML Grid Editor" tab to edit the XML configuration.

Under "5.- Grid Columns" we will edit the columns that make up this grid. As in the SELECT statement all the columns have been included "*" the generator will use them all by default.

We select some columns that we will remove.

Next we will edit the context menu in this section before creating the various items from which this context menu will be made up, we specify the fields we want to use to call URLs, in this case we want to transfer the CUSTOMERID’s column value to another page.

For this reason, we will enter the column name in fields.

In Formats, we must establish and match the name of one of the fields that we have previously established in Fields, and assign a code that we will use later to replace. This code will be later replaced by the CUSTOMERID value.

Once these fields have been assigned, we can create the ContextMenuItem; we'll add a new context menu and we'll assign an image from layouts, we will give it a name (in this case "View Orders") and finally we will add the page to which we want to be redirected in the URL.

In the URL we will specify the CustomersOrders.aspx page, the  parameter’s name that we are going to transfer in this case “CustomerID" and  its value, in this case %Cust%  that at the time when it will be called will be replaced by the column CUSTOMERID value that we are in.

Once the process is completed, we will accept the changes and we will generate the XML.

Finally we will copy the contents into an ActionGrid, and the result will be as follows

By clicking on "View Orders" we will be redirected to the  "CustomersOrders.aspx" page in this case  the url will be CustomersOrders.aspx?CustomerID=ANATR
